snippet: The suspect, identified as David Baril, 30, was shot during a confrontation with officers on a busy Midtown street.
abstract: New York City police officers shoot and wound David Baril, suspect in multiple hammer attacks throughout city over several days; fired on Baril, who has history of mental illness and arrests, when he attacked one of them with blood-stained hammer; incident exemplifies dangers faced by police at time when use of force has come under national scrutiny.

byline.original: By J. DAVID GOODMAN and AL BAKER
byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by David W. Chen, Benjamin Mueller, Kate Pastor, Marc Santora and Vivian Yee, and research by Susan C. Beachy and Alain Delaquérière.

lead_paragraph: The suspect, identified as David Baril, 30, was shot during a confrontation with officers on a busy Midtown street.

headline.main: Police Shoot Hammer-Wielding Man Sought in 4 Manhattan Attacks
headline.print_headline: Police in Midtown Wound Suspect in Hammer Attacks
